messages.message: sarah lets have a vision meeting
What should we call this project?

Let's work on your vision together. We are in a vision meeting, so Mike, Alex, and Jordan won't chime in - it's just us for this focused discussion. This keeps our vision conversation productive and clear.

Great — to create a clear, actionable vision I need a few details. Please answer these (or tell me which to start with):

1. Project name (what should we call this?) — I have "o1" noted; is that correct?
2. What problem does your app solve? Why will users care?
3. Who are the target users (personas, demographics, tech comfort)?
4. Key features you envision (MVP must-haves vs nice-to-haves)
5. Success criteria / metrics (how will we know this is successful?)
6. Constraints or requirements (budget, timeline, platforms, tech stack, legal/privacy, integrations)
7. Any competitors or inspiration we should consider?

Which question would you like to start with, or go ahead and answer them in order.

how is this -- 	1.	Project name
BrightHR Lite
	2.	Problem
Small businesses struggle to manage employee data, leave requests, and compliance documents in spreadsheets or email threads. This causes errors, lost information, and wasted admin time.
	3.	Target users / primary personas
	•	Small business owners (10–50 staff) — want to streamline HR admin.
	•	HR managers / office admins — need an easy way to track people and policies.
	•	Employees — want a simple self-service tool to request leave and update personal info.
	4.	Key features
	•	Must-haves:
• Employee directory (basic profiles, contact info)
• Leave / absence management (request, approve, calendar view)
• Document storage (contracts, policies, compliance docs)
	•	Nice-to-haves:
• Onboarding checklist for new hires
• Simple performance review tracking
• Email notifications for leave approvals
	5.	Success criteria / KPIs
	•	80% of employees use self-service for leave requests in first 3 months
	•	Reduce HR admin time spent on leave tracking by 50%
	•	All employee records stored digitally with 100% completeness
	•	Average user satisfaction score ≥ 4/5 from pilot team
	6.	Constraints / requirements
	•	Web-only (no mobile app in Phase 1)
	•	Lightweight, low-cost hosting (budget <$5K for pilot)
	•	Must comply with GDPR basics (data export & deletion)
	•	Deployment target: Vercel (frontend) + Supabase (backend DB)
	7.	Existing assets / references
	•	Current spreadsheets with employee data and leave history
	•	Looking at BambooHR and CharlieHR as inspiration for UI/UX

Let's work on your vision together. We are in a vision meeting, so Mike, Alex, and Jordan won't chime in - it's just us for this focused discussion. This keeps our vision conversation productive and clear.

This looks great — here's a concise vision summary based on what you shared:

Project name
- BrightHR Lite

Problem we solve
- Small businesses (10–50 staff) currently manage employee data, leave requests, and compliance docs in spreadsheets and email, causing errors, lost info, and high admin overhead. BrightHR Lite centralizes these tasks to reduce mistakes and save time.

Target users / personas
- Small business owners (10–50 staff) who want simpler HR admin
- HR managers / office admins who need easy tracking of people and policies
- Employees who want a simple self-service tool for leave and personal info updates

Core features (MVP)
- Employee directory (basic profiles, contact info)
- Leave/absence management (request, approve, calendar view)
- Document storage (contracts, policies, compliance docs)

Nice-to-have features (post-MVP)
- Onboarding checklist for new hires
- Simple performance review tracking
- Email notifications for leave approvals

Success criteria / KPIs
- 80% of employees use self-service for leave requests within first 3 months
- 50% reduction in HR admin time spent on leave tracking
- 100% of employee records stored digitally and complete
- Average user satisfaction ≥ 4/5 from pilot team

Constraints & requirements
- Web-only in Phase 1 (no mobile app)
- Low-cost pilot budget (< $5K)
- GDPR basics compliance (data export & deletion)
- Deployment: Vercel (frontend) + Supabase (backend DB)

Existing assets & inspiration
- Current spreadsheets with employee data and leave history will be migrated
- UI/UX inspiration: BambooHR and CharlieHR

Next steps
- Should I go ahead and save this vision for the team? (If you're not ready, I can save it as a draft instead.)
please save this as a draft
✅ Vision document 'Vision' saved successfully! (ID: BrightHR_Lite_Vision_Draft_20251004_084213). The vision is now available via the Vision button.

Thanks — this is a clear improvement. Here’s a concise, ready-to-save vision based on your latest version:

Project name
- BrightHR Lite--CORRECT TIME

Problem
- Small businesses struggle to manage employee data, leave requests, and compliance documents in spreadsheets or email threads. This causes errors, lost information, and wasted admin time.

Target users / primary personas
- Small business owners (10–50 staff) — want to streamline HR admin
- HR managers / office admins — need an easy way to track people and policies
- Employees — want a simple self-service tool to request leave and update personal info

Key features
- Must-haves (MVP)
  - Employee directory (basic profiles, contact info)
  - Leave / absence management (request, approve, calendar view)
  - Document storage (contracts, policies, compliance docs)
- Nice-to-haves (post-MVP)
  - Onboarding checklist for new hires
  - Simple performance review tracking
  - Email notifications for leave approvals

Success criteria / KPIs
- 80% of employees use self-service for leave requests in the first 3 months
- Reduce HR admin time spent on leave tracking by 50%
- All employee records stored digitally with 100% completeness
- Average user satisfaction score ≥ 4/5 from pilot team

Constraints / requirements
- Web-only (no mobile app in Phase 1)
- Lightweight, low-cost hosting (pilot budget < $5K)
- GDPR basics compliance (data export & deletion)
- Deployment target: Vercel (frontend) + Supabase (backend DB)

Existing assets / references
- Current spreadsheets with employee data and leave history (for migration)
- UI/UX inspiration: BambooHR and CharlieHR
